Setting Configuration Options

Projects that have a configuration file already associated with them are displayed in the desktop client with a folder icon that has a black tab.

To configure options for a project database or project:

  1. Select a project database or project you want to configure.

  2. If the project database or project has a configuration file associated with it, go to the next step. Otherwise, associate a configuration file with it by doing the following:

    1. Select File | Properties. The Properties dialog box appears with the Project or Project Database tab active.
    2. In the Configuration File field, enter the location of the configuration file to be associated with the project database or project.
    3. Click OK.

  3. Select Admin | Configure Project. The Configure Project dialog box appears with the General tab active.

  4. If not already selected, select the Show Advanced Options check box to see all of the available options.

  5. Select the option you want to define in the Options list on the General tab or select one of the other tabs. Click here to see the available options.

  6. Click OK if you are finished defining options, or click Apply to save the settings and continue to define other options.
